qas.question: What subfield of anthropology studies mental processes?
What does psychological anthropology particularly focus on in a particular culture group?
What aspects define a cultural group?

answers.text: its own history, language, practices, and conceptual categories

qas.question: What shapes processes of human cognition?
Psychological anthropology examines how our models of social processes are informed by what?
What subfield of anthropolgy studies mental health?
Where does Pysychological anthropology defocus on human development and enculteration?

context: <a0_0><b5_0>Psychological<a0_0/> anthropology<b5_0/> is an interdisciplinary subfield of anthropology that studies the interaction of cultural and mental processes. This subfield tends to focus on ways in which <a1_0>humans' development and enculturation<a1_0/> within <b6_0>a particular <a3_0>cultural group<b6_0/><a3_0/>—with <a2_0>its own history, language, practices, and conceptual categories<a2_0/>—shape processes of <b7_0>human cognition<b7_0/>, emotion, perception, motivation, and mental health. It also examines how the <a4_0>understanding<a4_0/> of cognition, emotion, motivation, and similar psychological processes inform or constrain our models of cultural and social processes.
